item.description:
Cape Cod Raw Food Meetup Community presents

FREE viewing of the amazing documentary

THRIVE

 

Thrive is an unconventional documentary that lifts the veil on what's REALLY going on in our world by following the money upstream-uncovering the global consolidation of power in nearly every aspect of our lives.

Weaving together breakthroughs in science, consciousness and activism, THRIVE offers real solutions, empowering us with unprecedented and bold strategies for reclaiming our lives and our future. Why not have a transparent way to see who is funding the news we get and a way to assess what conflicts of interest they might have?

 

Cape Cod Raw Food Meetup’s mission is awakening the consciousness regarding our health, the food we eat and the world we live in.

05:30PM: Sign-in

05:40PM: Potluck*
06:15PM: Announcements and Demo.  Angie Doel, a Holistic Health Counselor and Dorothy Torrey will give a short demo on Sprouting, and also will be Debunking the Myth regarding Sprouting.                                                                                   

06:35 PM: THRIVE.  This is a "must see". Discussion follows.

FEE: FREE. Donations welcome to cover out-of-pocket expenses. Thank you!

Mark you calendars!

*Bring a raw/live, plant-based, organic dish to enjoy.
Experience the delicious variety of live raw foods.

Dorothy Torrey
Questions: 508-888-6677

WELCOME:Are you interested in fun and simply, a healthier way of eating? Are you suffering from a condition that may be food or lifestyle related? (85% of chronic diseases are)! The Cape Cod Raw (Fresh) Food Meetup could be just what you are looking for.

Wherever you are on your health journey,  there are great ways to transition. Even if you are attempting this for the first time, you will gain valuable information and support on food choices, and on enjoying an abundant life that for many are our heart's desire.  We gather for demos, lectures and other related events that encourages and supports us. ----Do some of us eat cooked food? Yes, however, for optimal cellular health, we love eating raw, fresh, live food. We welcome the newbie, the curious and the transitional.
item.name: FREE viewing of the Amazing Documentary THRIVE (plus a short demo on Sprouts)
